title: 1D's Perfect 'same' as Taylor Swift's Style
text:
One Direction's Perfect 'same' as Taylor Swift's Style Music Reprints & permissions 
Singers Gwen Stefani and Gavin Rossdale in October 2014 before announcing their split. Photo: Getty Images 
It's either an astoundingly clever musical and romantic tribute or further proof the world's pop factories are essentially churning out the same product with only a few tweaks here and there. 
Whatever your take, there's no doubt One Direction's latest release, Perfect , sounds laughably similar to Taylor Swift's 2014 song Style . 
And just to hammer the point home, one fan has mashed the two songs together to produce a result that is, arguably, a greater whole than the sum of its two parts, 
The trouble with Harry ... have 1-D pulled a Swifty? Photo: Tim P. Whitby 
The lyrics of the two songs even appear to answer each other in eerie fashion, particularly during the chorus of both songs. Advertisement 
Predictably, the uncanny similarity has sent fans into a frenzy of speculation centred around the supposed romance between Swift and Styles in 2012. 
But Swift herself appears not to be immune from the temptation to draw "inspiration" from the past. 
Blank Space from last year's album 1989 , appears to share a great deal of its musical DNA with Shaggy's 2000 hit, It Wasn't Me, s pawning several YouTube mashups. 
And in 2011, Axis of Awesome famously took pop's tendency to eat itself to its logical and absurd solution with the hit Four Chords . Using a well-worn progression (I-V-vi-IV for the musically minded), the comedy trio demonstrated just how musical ideas are recycled endlessly in a medley that included the Beatles' Let It Be and Aqua's Barbie Girl .
